page.title: 10VILLAGE ATTITUDES - DISLIKES
page.content: {RUDGWICK RESIDENTS}as with any{COMMUN- {ITY}have dislikes.A{MAJORITY}of people in a{SURVEY}stressed as a single main dislike the problems associated with the{VOLUME}of{TRAFFIC}and the lack of {PARKING FACILITIES}along{CHURCH STREET and the{A281}at{BUCKS GREEN.}The{WORR- {IES}included{SPEEDING VEHICLES,}danger from{CARS}and{LORRIES}parking near to shops and the{CONSTANT FLOW}of{THROUGH {TRAFFIC.}Other dislikes, however, were less serious in{COMPARISON}and related to the lack of certain{AMENITIES}and {FACILITIES}such as:the lack of a{BANK, {BUTCHER, CHEMIST,FISHMONGER}or{BAKERS and an{ABSENCE}of{MAINS GAS.}Reference was made,though,to the{NOISE}from the {FLIGHT PATH}of{GATWICK AIRPORT;}others stated a dislike of the{INFREQUENT BUS {SERVICES}whilst some expressed concern over the{SITING}of new housing and the lack of a{FOCAL POINT}in the village.
